label: A7B2C2_oP44_62_3c2d_2c_d-001
title: Possible $\delta$-Y$_{2}$Si$_{2}$O$_{7}$ Structure
comments:
(Diaz, 1990) found that some structures of RE$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$ (RE = Ho, Dy, Gd, Y) were in the centro-symmetric orthorhombic $Pnma$ \#62 space group, in which case this would be the prototype of $\delta$-RE$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$ (Becerro, 2004). 
 (Smolin, 1970) found \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C2_oP44_33_2a_7a_2a-001}{$\delta$-Gd$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$} to be in the non-centro-symmetric $Pna2_{1}$ \#33 space group. 
 (Becerro, 2004) found only one yttrium site in the $\delta$-structure, supporting (Diaz, 1990).  
 In addition if we allow a small amount of uncertainty (0.2{\AA}) in the atomic positions in the $Pna2_{1}$ structure findsym places this structure in the $Pnma$ group.  
 Nevertheless we have found no work explicitly stating that the structure of (Smolin, 1970) is in error, and indeed (Christensen, 1994) found $\delta$-Y$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$ in space group $Pna2_{1}$.  Given this ambiguity, we list Y$_{2}$O$_{7}$Si$_{2}$ only as a possible prototype for the $\delta$-phase pyrosilicates.
